alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Dauphin; Northumberland; Perry; Schuylkill; Snyder (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL SCHUYLKILL... SOUTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND...NORTHWESTERN DAUPHIN...SOUTHEASTERN SNYDER...NORTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND AND NORTHEASTERN PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Enola, moving northeast at 40 mph. Other strong storms were developing along a line of showers that extended northward to near Northumberland. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Harrisburg, Sunbury, Enola, Millersburg, Marysville, Trevorton, Lykens, Duncannon, Elizabethville, Williamstown, Port Trevorton, New Buffalo, Klingerstown, Leck Kill, Urban, Rebuck, Wertzville, Rockville, Dehart Dam and Liverpool. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Dauphin; Northumberland; Perry; Schuylkill; Snyder
